concept.title: Writing the Welcome Page
concept.shortdesc: This guideline describes how to write the Welcome page and to clarify its components. Every guide we publish must have a Welcome page. It functions as a title page for the HTML output.

conbody.note: The ID for the Welcome page must be welcome and the filename must be index.dita.

section.title: Writing the User/Admin Guide Welcome Page
section.p: When writing a new Welcome page use the following layout and guidelines. To write a Welcome page for a User or Administration Guide:

ol.li:
Open with a brief description of the guide. There is no heading to this paragraph:
Make it clear what the expected audience is
Make it clear what information will be presented in the doc
Explain the benefit of reading the doc
Example: “The Administration Guide provides you with an overview of the administration features, a description of management best practices, and detailed information about all administration-related actions.”

Follow with a brief description of the product. There is no heading to this paragraph.
Example: “Eucalyptus is open source software for building Amazon Web Services compatible private and hybrid clouds.”

Construct a new table:
Table section name “How Do I…?”
Table content is comprised of customer task-oriented statements in the left column followed by links to information in the right column. This should not be an exhaustive list of tasks or references, but rather should direct the users to the most important and frequently needed tasks.

section.p: The following example shows the basic structure and layout of the How Do I...? table. In an actual document, all the "Relevant Topics" would be linked.

row.entry: Get a summary of private cloud management tasks
Get a summary of access features
Get a summary of images and tasks

section.title: Writing the Euca2ools or Other Reference Welcome Page
section.p: The CLI reference (and any forthcoming API reference) is a simple resource. Reference guides have a simpler Welcome page. See the current the Euca2ools (CLI) Guide for help.
